page.title: 12The Post Office Ravensthorpe
page.content: The Post Office,Ravensthorpe is housed in a most attractive white washed cottage.It was built in 1610 with mud walls and a local straw thatch,the extension added in 1875 provides accom- adation for the post mistress & family. It plays an important role for the locals by giving a full postal service. Here you can pay bills,keep savings and collect weekly allowances or pensions. The post comes from Northampton - Mr and Mrs Hancox rise at 5.15am to sort & then deliver the mail.The paperboys deliver newspapers twice daily,the shop also sells a variety of groceries,bacon cheese,bread,sweets and tobacco.It is used more by people without their own personal transport.A recent local appraisal showed 69% use the shop regul -arly,82% the post office.No changes are foreseen for the near future as small P.O.'s are to be protected.
